title: National Hockey League - Carolina Hurricanes home attendance 2005 to 2019
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Total attendance, and Average attendance. The y axis represents Home attendance and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Total attendance is gradually decreasing, Average attendance is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Home attendance in descending order is: 1. Total attendance, and lastly, 2. Average attendance.
Overall across the Year, Total attendance mostly maintained the highest Home attendance when compared to others with a mean value of 595868.57, and it peaked at 2006/07.
Average attendance mostly had the least Home attendance with a mean value of 15081.43, which peaked at 2012/13 with a value of 17558.0.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Total attendance, and Average attendance. The y axis indicates the Home attendance and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Total attendance is gradually decreasing, Average attendance is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Home attendance in descending order is: 1. Total attendance, and lastly, 2. Average attendance.
Throughout the period, Total attendance generally had the highest Home attendance relative to others with an average of 595868.57, and it reached its maximum at 2006/07 with a value of 712861.0.
The botommost line, Average attendance,  has a mean of 15081.43, and peaked at 2012/13.
The difference of Home attendance between Total attendance and Average attendance is smaller at Year 2018/19 compared to the Year 2005/06.
